intro: Chamaesyce involuta, commonly known as curled sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Chamaesyce involuta typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. It is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and dry slopes.
